diagnosis.final_diagnosis: delusions of parasitosis aggravated by cocaine use
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient exhibited tactile hallucinations and a firm belief in insect infestation without objective evidence. His history of schizophrenia, cocaine use, and delusions, alongside an inability to respond to psychiatric evaluations, indicated substance-induced etiology. His delusions persisted over time despite medical evaluation, supporting the diagnosis of delusions of parasitosis aggravated by cocaine use.
